mainTopic.title: Antimicrobials
mainTopic.content_info: The lecture handouts come with a lot of detailed information that is sufficient to cover the whole topic

quizzes.question: What concentration is necessary for successful antimicrobial therapy, and what are its two main forms?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Successful antimicrobial therapy occurs with an effective concentration, either bacteriostatic (MIC) or bactericidal (MBC).
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Successful therapy only requires bactericidal concentration.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Successful therapy occurs with any concentration of antimicrobials.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Successful therapy occurs with bacteriostatic concentration alone.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Successful therapy does not depend on concentration.

quizzes.question: Which factors are essential to determine in drug absorption?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Effects of food, gastric pH, and antacids on drug absorption are essential to determine.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Only the effect of food is essential.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Only the effect of gastric pH is necessary.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Effects of temperature on drug absorption are essential.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Antacids have no effect on drug absorption.

subTopics.title: Penicillins, Cephalosporins, and other beta-lactam drugs

quizzes.question: What is the main mechanism of bacterial resistance to penicillin?
quizzes.goodAnswer: The main mechanism is enzymatic hydrolysis of the β-lactam bond by β-lactamases.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: The main mechanism is the alteration of bacterial DNA.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: The main mechanism is alteration in lipid membranes.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: The main mechanism is the permeabilization of the bacterial cell wall.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: The main mechanism is the enhanced uptake of penicillin.

quizzes.question: How do cephalosporins differ in spectrum of activity from penicillin?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Cephalosporins are broad-spectrum agents with increasing gram-negative activity from first to third generation.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Cephalosporins primarily target gram-positive bacteria as penicillin does.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Cephalosporins are only effective against aerobic bacteria.

quizzes.question: What is a noted consequence of aminoglycosides binding to bacterial ribosomes?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Aminoglycosides inhibit protein synthesis and cause genetic code reading errors.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Aminoglycosides only bind to 50S ribosomal units.

quizzes.question: What is the main mechanism of action for tetracyclines?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Tetracyclines inhibit protein synthesis by binding to the 30S ribosomal subunit.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Tetracyclines disrupt the bacterial cell wall.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Tetracyclines bind exclusively to mammalian cells.

quizzes.question: How do fluoroquinolones exert their bactericidal effect?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Fluoroquinolones inhibit DNA topoisomerases required for DNA supercoiling.

quizzes.question: Which type of bacteria are fluoroquinolones particularly effective against?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Fluoroquinolones are particularly effective against aerobic gram-negative bacilli.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Fluoroquinolones are only effective against gram-positive cocci.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Fluoroquinolones are only effective against methicillin-resistant strains.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Fluoroquinolones are only effective against fungi.

subTopics.title: General principles of antimicrobial use and antimicrobial resistance

quizzes.question: What are two critical reasons for combining antimicrobial agents in therapy?
quizzes.goodAnswer: To prevent resistant organisms emergence and achieve antimicrobial synergy.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: To increase side effects and achieve cost savings.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: To ensure rapid degradation and boost metabolism.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: To enhance bacterial mutation and preserve tissue integrity.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: To achieve easier administration and reduce protein binding.

quizzes.question: Which factor influences the initial choice of antibiotics?
quizzes.goodAnswer: The identity of the infecting organism and its antimicrobial susceptibility pattern.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: The geographic location of the patient.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: The patient's family history of infections.
